de.uniheidelberg.cl.swp.preproc
Class JavaRapPreProcessing

java.lang.Object
  de.uniheidelberg.cl.swp.preproc.JavaRapPreProcessing

public class JavaRapPreProcessing
extends java.lang.Object

This class provides the conversion features needed to process both training and test data with JavaRap and stores their results so that they can be used by JavaRapRunner afterwards.
It's possible to execute JavaRap remotely on a specified server.

Javarap.jar is required: http://aye.comp.nus.edu.sg/~qiu/NLPTools/JavaRAP.html

The results are stored in the folder ./Basedata/javarap/ for the corresponding MMAX2 corpus.

The current SSHConnection.

run

public void run(java.lang.String corpus,
                boolean useSsh,
                java.lang.String javaRapPath)
Runs the JavaRap-System for the specified file. After running JavaRap, the results are processed to extract the coreferents and stored in ./Basedata/javarap/.txt

Parameters:
corpus - Either training or test. The path has to be specified via Configuration).
useSsh - True, if a remote connection should be used, false if a local version of JavaRap should be used.
javaRapPath - Path to AnaphoraResolution.jar (i.e. path to JavaRap).

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
Main method to run JavaRap on the training and test data. Syntax:
java de.uniheidelberg.cl.swp.preproc.JavaRapPreProcessing ssh|loc

To run JavaRap Preprocessing:

1. Make sure that training and test files have been specified correctly in the config file! 2. Make sure you have chmod 777 set on the temporary folder!

To run JavaRap using a remote connection
java de.uniheidelberg.cl.swp.preproc.JavaRapPreProcessing ssh (note: you are prompted for your credentials)

To run JavaRap locally
java de.uniheidelberg.cl.swp.preproc.JavaRapPreProcessing loc

Parameters:
args - path Path to the JavaRap jar file (AnaphoraResoultion.jar has to exist).
ssh|loc Determines local or remote execution.
